fr:title.text: Coequalizer › universal property of the coequalizer

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Coequalizer › universal property of the coequalizer

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A coequalizer is a colimit of a diagram of shape \bullet \rightrightarrows \bullet .
Since functors preserve equations and the property of being a split coequalizer is equationally witnessed, it is preserved by any functor.

To show the universal property of the coequalizer, let y\xrightarrow {k}w be such that kf = kg. By the equality ksh = kft = kgt = k, is this a factorization, as desired. Uniqueness follows because h is a retract, hence in particular an epi.
A coequalizer is a colimit of a diagram of shape \bullet \rightrightarrows \bullet .
A commutatitive diagram in a category C is a functor J\xrightarrow {D} C. The domain J is called the indexing category or the shape of the diagram.
